summary: The Service-Connected Suicide Compensation Act (H.R. 2264) amends Title 38 of the United States Code. It mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to automatically pay dependency and indemnity compensation to the survivors (spouse, children, and parents) of a veteran who dies by suicide and has a service-connected mental disorder. The bill aims to provide financial support to families affected by veteran suicide stemming from service-related mental health conditions.
